info.title: Digital Identity Management
info.description:
## TMF API Reference: TMF720 - Digital Identity Management

### Version 4.0. - January 2021 

Digital Identity Management API goal is to provide the ability to manage a digital identity. This digital identity allows to identify an individual, a resource, or a partyRole (a specific role - or set of roles - for a given individual). A digital identity is associated with credential/authentification method. These credential/authentification methods should be extensible to describe all type of authentification method like login/password, biometric, token, etc.. A contact medium is also associated with digital identity (or directly at credential level) to manage credential recovery UCs.

get.description: This operation list or find DigitalIdentity entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a DigitalIdentity entity.

Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

AttachmentRef.description: Attachment reference. An attachment complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures

href.description: URL serving as reference for the attachment resource

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

AttachmentRefOrValue.description: An attachment by value or by reference. An attachment complements the description of an element, for example through a document, a video, a picture.

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

BiometricCredential.description: A Credential based on a login and a password.

id.description: an identifier for a credential/authentification method for this digital identity

biometricSubType.description: a biometric sub type when required like for finger: thumb, index, ring , pinkyFinger, etc

biometricType.description: a biometric type like finger, iris, face, etc...

state.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle state of this credential (like active, inactive, expired).

trustLevel.description: A level of assurance associated with this credential - this could be used to limit/allow specific permission based on this trust level.

attachment.description: List of attachment(s) associated with this biometric data.

contactMedium.description: List of contact medium associated with this credential/authentification method.

validFor.description: The period for which this digial identity is valid.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

Credential.description: Credential is a class that allow to describe an authentification method.

id.description: an identifier for a credential/authentification method for this digital identity

state.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle state of this credential (like active, inactive, expired).

trustLevel.description: A level of assurance associated with this credential - this could be used to limit/allow specific permission based on this trust level.

contactMedium.description: List of contact medium associated with this credential/authentification method.

validFor.description: The period for which this digial identity is valid.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

DigitalIdentity.description: DigitalIdentity is a class that allow to describe a digital identity for an individual or a resource or a specific party role. One of these three MUST be provided. If an individual is provided, this identity will be for all her/his partyRole. To avoid confusion it is recommended in this case to not provide partyRoleIdentified.

creationDate.description: Date and time of the Digital Identity creation (timestamp)

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the Digital Identity last update (timestamp)

nickname.description: Nickname associated to this digital identity (like Juanito17 or the QuebecMoose etc...).

status.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status of this digital identity (unknown, active, suspended, archived).

attachment.description: List of attachment associated with this digital identity. Could be use to link a cute cat or moose picture to a digital identity for example.

contactMedium.description: List of contact medium associated with the digital identity.

credential.description: A list of credential/authentification method that are used for this digital identity.

individualIdentified.description: Individual identified by this digital identity. In this case the digitial identity is for all her/his role. It is recommended to not provide partyRoleIdentified if individualIdentified provided

partyRoleIdentified.description: Related Parties who are identified by this digital identity.

relatedParty.description: Parties who have an interest in this digital identity (like the organization in charge of providing identity). This is NOT the party identified by this digital identity.

resourceIdentified.description: Resource identified by this digital identity. It is recommended to no provided individualIdentified or partyRoleIdentified if resourceIdentified provided.

validFor.description: The period for which this digial identity is valid.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

DigitalIdentity_Create.description:
DigitalIdentity is a class that allow to describe a digital identity for an individual or a resource or a specific party role. One of these three MUST be provided. If an individual is provided, this identity will be for all her/his partyRole. To avoid confusion it is recommended in this case to not provide partyRoleIdentified.
Skipped properties: id,href,status,digitalIdentityDate

DigitalIdentityContactMedium.description: Indicates the contact medium that could be used to contact the party.

contactType.description: Type of the contact medium to qualifiy it like pro email / personal email. This is not used to define the contact medium used.

preferred.description: If true, indicates that is the preferred contact medium

validFor.description: The time period that the contact medium is valid for

EmailMedium.description: Describes an email that could be used to contact a party (an individual or an organization)

contactType.description: Type of the contact medium to qualifiy it like pro email / personal email. This is not used to define the contact medium used.

emailAddress.description: Full email address in standard format

preferred.description: If true, indicates that is the preferred contact medium

validFor.description: The time period that the contact medium is valid for

LoginPasswordCredential.description: A Credential based on a login and a password.

id.description: an identifier for a credential/authentification method for this digital identity

password.description: credential password - must be in write only

state.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle state of this credential (like active, inactive, expired).

trustLevel.description: A level of assurance associated with this credential - this could be used to limit/allow specific permission based on this trust level.

contactMedium.description: List of contact medium associated with this credential/authentification method.

validFor.description: The period for which this digial identity is valid.

NetworkCredential.description: A Credential based on a login and a password.

id.description: an identifier for a credential/authentification method for this digital identity

password.description: credential password to use resource based credential - must be in write only

state.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle state of this credential (like active, inactive, expired).

trustLevel.description: A level of assurance associated with this credential - this could be used to limit/allow specific permission based on this trust level.

contactMedium.description: List of contact medium associated with this credential/authentification method.

resource.description: Resource used by a network credential.

validFor.description: The period for which this digial identity is valid.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the contact
